evidence.text: In 1971, President Nixon issued an Executive Order granting collective bargaining rights to members of the Foreign Service
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: In 1971, President Nixon issued an Executive Order granting collective bargaining rights to members of the Foreign Service.

evidence.text: In 1980 Congress enacted the Foreign Service Labor-Management Relations Statute to guarantee those rights
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: In 1980 Congress enacted the Foreign Service Labor-Management Relations Statute to guarantee those rights.

evidence.text: Through ten presidencies, our Secretaries of State have recognized and bargained with the American Foreign Service Association (“AFSA”).
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Through ten presidencies, Secretaries of State have recognized and bargained with AFSA.

evidence.text: President Trump has now issued an executive order illegally terminating the Foreign Service’s statutory collective bargaining rights
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: President Trump issued an executive order illegally terminating the Foreign Service’s statutory collective bargaining rights.

evidence.text: This lawsuit seeks to set aside and enjoin this ultra vires action because the scope of the termination of collective bargaining rights is not authorized by the Foreign Service Labor-Management Relations Statute
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: The lawsuit seeks to set aside and enjoin this ultra vires action.

evidence.text: This Court has jurisdiction over this matter pursuant to 28 U.S.C. § 1331 ... Venue is proper ... pursuant to 28 U.S.C. § 1391(e)
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Jurisdiction established under 28 U.S.C. § 1331 and venue under 28 U.S.C. § 1391(e).

evidence.text: AFSA was founded in 1924 as a professional association and advocate for the Members of the United States Foreign Service
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: AFSA was founded in 1924 as a professional association and advocate for the Members of the United States Foreign Service.

evidence.text: approximately 18,000 active duty members of the Foreign Service employed by the Department of State and the U.S. Agency for International Development (“USAID”), as well as the Foreign Commercial Service (“FCS”) in the Department of Commerce, Foreign Agricultural Service (“AFS”), Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service (“APHIS”) in the Department of Agriculture, and U.S. Agency for Global Media (“USAGM”).
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: AFSA has approximately 18,000 active duty members in federal agencies such as State, USAID, FCS, AFS, APHIS, and USAGM.

evidence.text: The Defendant Donald J. Trump is the President of the United States and is being sued in his official capacity.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Donald J. Trump is sued in his official capacity as President.

evidence.text: The Office of Personnel Management (“OPM”) is a federal agency headquartered in Washington, D.C.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Office of Personnel Management (OPM) is a federal agency headquartered in Washington, D.C.

evidence.text: The U.S. Department of State (“State”) is a federal agency headquartered in Washington, D.C.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Department of State is a federal agency headquartered in Washington, D.C.

evidence.text: The U.S. Agency for International Development (“USAID”) is a federal agency headquartered in Washington, D.C.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID) is a federal agency headquartered in Washington, D.C.

evidence.text: The Defendant Marco Rubio is the Secretary of State as well as the Acting Director of USAID.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Marco Rubio is sued as Secretary of State and Acting Director of USAID.

evidence.text: The Defendant Charles Ezell is the Acting Director of the U.S. Office of Personnel Management.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Charles Ezell is sued as Acting Director of OPM.

evidence.text: In 1978, Congress enacted Chapter 71 of the Civil Service Reform Act, also known as the Federal Service Labor-Management Relations Statute
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: In 1978, Congress enacted Chapter 71 of the Civil Service Reform Act, also known as the Federal Service Labor-Management Relations Statute.

evidence.text: The FSLMRS defines “employee” … a member of the [Foreign] Service who is a citizen of the United States, wherever serving, other than a management official, a confidential employee, a consular agent, a member of the Service who is a United Citizen
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: The FSLMRS defines “employee” as a member of the Foreign Service who is a citizen of the United States, etc.

evidence.text: The FSLMRS covers only Foreign Service members who are employed by the Department of State, the Broadcasting Board of Governors (now known as U.S. Agency for Global Media), USAID, and the Departments of Commerce and Agriculture
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: The FSLMRS covers only Foreign Service members employed by State, U.S. Agency for Global Media, USAID, and Departments of Commerce and Agriculture.

evidence.text: The FSLMRS guarantees the rights of Foreign Service members to form, join, assist and serve as representatives of a labor organization
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: The FSLMRS guarantees the rights of Foreign Service members to form, join, assist and serve as representatives of a labor organization.

evidence.text: The FSLMRS excludes ... employees engaged in personnel work in other than a purely clerical capacity; ... employees engaged in criminal or national security investigations
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: The FSLMRS excludes certain employees from bargaining, such as those in non‑clerical capacity or national security work.

evidence.text: The FSLMRS provides that a labor organization who is the exclusive bargaining representative of a worldwide bargaining unit, such as AFSA, shall be the representative of all Foreign Service members in that unit
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: The FSLMRS requires AFSA to represent all Foreign Service members in its bargaining unit, without regard to membership status.

evidence.text: The FSLMRS requires the parties to negotiate in good faith for purposes of arriving at a collective bargaining agreement ... and to execute a written document embodying any agreement resulting from their collective bargaining
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: The FSLMRS requires the parties to negotiate in good faith for a collective bargaining agreement and to execute a written document embodying that agreement.

evidence.text: The FSLMRS establishes the three-member Foreign Service Labor Relations Board (“Board”) which is chaired by the Chair of the Federal Labor Relations Authority
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: The FSLMRS establishes the Foreign Service Labor Relations Board to supervise elections and resolve disputes.

evidence.text: In 1973, AFSA was certified under Executive Order 11636 as the exclusive representative for Foreign Service members employed worldwide by the Department of State and, following a separate election by Foreign Service members at USAID, as their exclusive representative.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: AFSA was certified under Executive Order 11636 as the exclusive representative for Foreign Service members in State and USAID.

evidence.text: AFSA negotiated “Framework Agreements” with the Department of State and USAID governing their relationship under the authority of the Foreign Service Labor Management Relations Statute
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: AFSA negotiated Framework Agreements with State and USAID governing their relationship.

evidence.text: On January 20, 2025 Defendant Trump issued an Executive Order titled “Reevaluating and Realigning United States Foreign Aid,”
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: On January 20, 2025, Trump issued Executive Order 14,211 titled “Reevaluating and Realigning United States Foreign Aid.”

evidence.text: On January 26, 2025, at least fifty‑six senior career agency staff, many of whom are Foreign Service members, were put on administrative leave
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: On January 26, 2025, at least fifty‑six senior career agency staff were put on administrative leave.

evidence.text: On February 3, USAID’s headquarters were shut down
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: On February 3, 2025, USAID’s headquarters were shut down.

evidence.text: AFSA issued a press release “strongly objecting to the administration’s decision to dismantle the United States Agency for International Development (USAID).”
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: AFSA issued a press release objecting to the administration’s decision to dismantle USAID.

evidence.text: On February 7, Judge Nichols issued a temporary restraining order against the administrative leave and recall.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: On February 7, 2025, Judge Nichols issued a temporary restraining order against the administrative leave and recall.

evidence.text: On February 12, Defendant Trump issued Executive Order 14,211, “One Voice for America’s Foreign Relations,”
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: On February 12, 2025, Trump issued Executive Order 14,211, “One Voice for America’s Foreign Relations.”

evidence.text: On February 22, AFSA issued another press release criticizing the Defendant Ezell’s requirement that Foreign Service members ... provide a weekly report to OPM of their accomplishments
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: On February 22, 2025, AFSA issued a press release criticizing Ezell’s requirement for weekly reports to OPM.

evidence.text: On March 11, AFSA issued another press release stating that it “is alarmed by reports that USAID has directed the destruction of classified and sensitive documents”
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: On March 11, 2025, AFSA issued another press release stating it was alarmed by USAID’s destruction of classified documents.

evidence.text: On March 19, AFSA issued another press release criticizing the removal of Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Accessibility factors
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: On March 19, 2025, AFSA issued a press release criticizing the removal of diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility factors.

evidence.text: On March 21, AFSA and others filed suit against the Administration in the Southern District of New York to enjoin the disbandment of the U.S. Agency for Global Media (“USAGM”),
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: On March 21, 2025, AFSA and others filed suit against the Administration in the Southern District of New York to enjoin the disbandment of USAGM.

evidence.text: On March 28, U.S. District Judge Oetken issued a temporary restraining order prohibiting “any further attempt to terminate, reduce‑in‑force, place on leave, or furlough any USAGM employee.”
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: On March 28, 2025, U.S. District Judge Oetken issued a temporary restraining order prohibiting further attempts to terminate AFSA.

evidence.text: On March 27, 2025 Defendant Trump issued Executive Order No. 14,251, Exclusions from Federal Labor‑Management Programs,
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: On March 27, 2025, Trump issued Executive Order 14,251, Exclusions from Federal Labor‑Management Programs.

evidence.text: On March 27, 2025 Defendant Ezell issued a Memorandum to Heads and Acting Heads of Departments and Agencies instructing them to discontinue participation in ongoing and future grievance procedures, ... guidance on Executive Order Exclusions from Federal Labor‑Management Programs
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: On March 27, 2025, Ezell issued guidance on Executive Order Exclusions from Federal Labor‑Management Programs.

evidence.text: On March 31 the Chief Labor Management Negotiator at the Department of State sent AFSA officers the following email shutting down AFSA operations
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: On March 31, 2025, the Chief Labor Management Negotiator at the Department of State sent AFSA officers a notice shutting down AFSA operations.

args.reason: All checklist items (Factual_Basis_of_Case) have been extracted from the available documents.
All distinct factual basis items have been extracted from the Complaint, and no additional unique facts were identified in other documents.
